item.title: PowerSchool hack exposes student, teacher data from K-12 districts
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Education software giant PowerSchool has confirmed it suffered a cybersecurity incident that allowed a threat actor to steal the personal information of students and teachers from school districts using its PowerSchool SIS platform. [...]

item.title: Casio says data of 8,500 people exposed in October ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Japanese electronics manufacturer Casio says that the October 2024 ransomware incident exposed the personal data of approximately 8,500 people. [...]

item.title: New Mirai botnet targets industrial routers with zero-day exploits
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A relatively new Mirai-based botnet has been growing in sophistication and is now leveraging zero-day exploits for security flaws in industrial routers and smart home devices. [...]

item.title: US govt launches cybersecurity safety label for smart devices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Today, the White House announced the launch of the U.S. Cyber Trust Mark, a new cybersecurity safety label for internet-connected consumer devices. [...]

item.title: BIOS flaws expose iSeq DNA sequencers to bootkit attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: BIOS/UEFI vulnerabilities in the iSeq 100 DNA sequencer from U.S. biotechnology company Illumina could let attackers disable devices used for detecting illnesses and developing vaccines. [...]

item.title: CISA warns of critical Oracle, Mitel flaws exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA has warned U.S. federal agencies to secure their systems against critical vulnerabilities in Oracle WebLogic Server and Mitel MiCollab systems that are actively exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: Washington state sues T-Mobile over 2021 data breach security failures
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Washington state has sued T-Mobile over failing to secure the sensitive personal information of over 2 million Washington residents in a 2021 data breach. [...]

item.title: UN aviation agency investigating 'potential' security breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​On Monday, the United Nations' International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) announced it was investigating what it described as a "reported security incident." [...]

item.title: Telegram hands over data on thousands of users to US law enforcement
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Telegram reveals that the communications platform has fulfilled 900 U.S. government requests, sharing the phone number or IP address information of 2,253 users with law enforcement. [...]

item.title: Malicious Browser Extensions are the Next Frontier for Identity Attacks
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by LayerX
item.description: A recent campaign targeting browser extensions illustrates that they are the next frontier in identity attacks. Learn more about these attacks from LayerX Security and how to receive a free extension audit. [...]

item.title: Green Bay Packers' online store hacked to steal credit cards
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Green Bay Packers American football team is notifying fans that a threat actor hacked its official online retail store in October and injected a card skimmer script to steal customers' personal and payment information. [...]

item.title: CISA says recent government hack limited to US Treasury
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) said today that the Treasury Department breach disclosed last week did not impact other federal agencies. [...]

item.title: Vulnerable Moxa devices expose industrial networks to attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Industrial networking and communications provider Moxa is warning of a high-severity and a critical vulnerability that impact various models of its cellular routers, secure routers, and network security appliances. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers also breached Charter and Windstream networks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​More U.S. companies have been added to the list of telecommunications firms hacked in a wave of breaches by a Chinese state-backed threat group tracked as Salt Typhoon. [...]
